Cognizant Manufacturing on AWS

Enhance efficiency, streamline operations, and protect assets.

Why AWS?

For 25 years, Amazon has been designing and manufacturing smart products and distributing them—plus billions of other manufacturers’ products—through Amazon’s globally connected distribution network. Amazon Web Services (AWS) was literally born from our own complex automation and factory operations. We use cutting-edge automation, machine learning (ML), artificial intelligence (AI), and robotics.

AWS helps you transform manufacturing operations with the most comprehensive and advanced set of cloud solutions available. Instead of focusing on building and maintaining your infrastructure, you can concentrate your resources on creating new product opportunities, improving operational efficiencies across the value chain, and optimizing production.

Improve product design and production processes

AWS delivers virtually unlimited High Performance Computing (HPC), which lets you innovate quickly without adding infrastructure. When they run HPC in the cloud, your designers, scientists, and engineers can use model-based design and large-scale parallel simulations to solve complex computing challenges.

You can reduce time to results and time to market for products by running more parallel tasks than an on-premises environment would allow. In addition, having optimized central processing unit (CPU), graphics processing unit (GPU), and field programmable gate array(FPGA) servers available on demand helps reduce costs.

  • High Performance Computing (HPC)

  • Reduce time to results and to market

  • Reduce costs

Using electronic design automation (EDA) to develop and deploy smart products can be complex and costly, but using HPC on AWS with Amazon FreeRTOS (real-time operating system, our open-source operating system for multicontrollers) gives you the flexibility to right-size your compute environment to meet the unique needs of each application. By maintaining a universal connection to the AWS cloud platform throughout the process, you can deploy all or just part of your EDA workflow for faster project completion times, increased EDA performance, and reduced costs.

Get smart with your data

Manufacturing is dependent on data – not just gathering it, but using it effectively. To continually get more out of data at every point, you can leverage the full range of AWS tools, including IoT services, edge computing, data lakes, ML, AI, and advanced analytics tools.

From collection to processing, from storage to analysis, from visualization to execution on the production floor, AWS helps you use data to improve smart product development and manufacturing operations.

Advanced analytics can help optimize data gathered from disparate sources and different systems. With Amazon apps such as Kinesis and SageMaker, or services such as AWS Managed Blockchain to digitize data at the source, you can get instantly accessible, end-to-end information.

You can use that data to glean valuable insights: track the supply chain more precisely, predict equipment failures ahead of time, use accurate projections to increase production appropriately, produce higher-quality products, and boost profits.

Streamline operations and enhance security

As a manufacturer, you want to focus on innovation and improving business operations, not on IT and operational technology (OT) infrastructure. Building and tailoring an AWS-enabled data lake lets you securely store, categorize, and analyze all your data in one centralized cloud repository. That gives you the ability to apply real-time and predictive analytics to improve overall equipment effectiveness (OEE), service levels, product quality, and supply chain efficiency.

With OT infrastructure cyberattacks on the rise, cloud security is our highest priority at AWS. When you work with us, you’ll benefit from a data center and network architecture that’s built to meet the requirements of the most security-sensitive industries and organizations. And you will protect your factory by leveraging S3 and other storage services in the AWS cloud for a viable and realistic disaster recovery plan.

Cognizant Solutions for Manufacturing on AWS

Cognizant delivers solutions on AWS that modernize manufacturing ecosystems while enhancing efficiency, streamlining operations, and protecting assets. With a focus on innovating customer experiences, Cognizant works to ensure manufacturers leverage both cross-sell and upsell opportunities to improve profitability and customer satisfaction.

Facilities management

Cognizant Connected Places uses AWS IoT infrastructure to connect facilities within a unified digital-oversight platform. This allows facilities managers – including those in hospitals, hotels, banks, warehouses, and other locations – to decrease overhead costs, optimize energy use, and create responsive, comfortable environments.

Key features
Smart devices and digital connectivity are key components of the Connected Places solution. By leveraging IoT and integrating AWS partner offerings, Connected Places transforms facilities into efficient, interconnected ecosystems.
  • Unified platform. The solution uses custom dashboards to provide an integrated view of buildings and assets.
  • Business and technology advisory. The solution provides end-to-end advisory services for facilities management.
  • Partner-sensor marketplace. Augment your existing building management system (BMS) with next-gen IoT sensors to gain new insights.
  • Service integration. Connected Places includes competency and certification in industry-leading BMS and integrated workplace management (IWMS) platforms.
  • Operational services. The solution offers implementation and operational services for enhancing maintenance and field services.
Benefits
Connected places aren’t just more comfortable—they’re also safer, more cost-effective, and more efficient. Plus, digital transformation invites further operational gains by enabling quick integration of new innovations.
  • Effect efficient energy consumption. Gather and analyze data on a building’s energy use, temperature, humidity, and related inputs.
  • Optimize maintenance costs. Perform predictive maintenance, remotely update software, or add features to connected building systems and controls.
  • Enhance experience and comfort. Address complaints or requests from employees, customers, or tenants to increase occupant comfort.
  • Monitor environmental systems in real time. Monitor all systems and generate alerts with a single solution.
  • Monitor installed and mobile equipment with IoT. Extend IoT capability to a complete range of equipment in buildings and vehicles.

Customer references

  • A leading department store automates energy scheduling from a single point of control for 2,000 stores.

  • A national insurer sources BMS data from more than 100 data points in each building to monitor and manage risk.

  • The world’s largest quick-service restaurant implements smart work solutions, streamlining work-order management and space management.

  • Embracing Smarter Facilities Management

Fleet management

Cloud migration offers substantial advantages to carrier fleets and railways. Instead of managing invisible moving parts along the supply chain, dispatchers and fleet managers who use Cognizant’s fleet management solution gain stunning visibility into all aspects of operation, from vehicle and driver locations to asset lifecycle insights.

Key features
Linking vehicle-placed IoT sensors to cloud-based technologies and analytics allows carriers and infrastructure providers to handle their fleet and asset management challenges as cost-effectively as possible.
  • Geofencing and geotagging. Asset-tracking geospatial devices track, monitor, and report vehicle movement and driver behavior.
  • Centralized command center. Integrated, consolidated systems with advanced filtering options let stakeholders identify and locate vehicles and dealers.
  • Easy-to-use portal. A central portal monitors, triages, and triggers events for vehicles, based on IoT data.
  • Open architecture–based cloud platform. Integration with any telematics device ensures speedy time to market for new capabilities.
  • Designed for scale and speed. A high-performance, low-latency solution helps manufacturers leverage and share vehicle data in real time.
Benefits
Digital solutions bring new efficiency, better operational control, and superior supply chain visibility. Enterprises can differentiate themselves by improving the uptime of their vehicles and increasing customer loyalty.
  • Faster communication. Rapid three-way communication among the fleet, dealers, and manufacturers delivers quick approvals and updates.
  • Greater fleet uptime. The solution decreases unplanned maintenance events while ensuring necessary repairs happen faster.
  • Improved safety and fuel efficiency. Monitoring driver behaviors keeps your fleet safer and more efficient.
  • Increased profit and market share. Fleet management boosts reputation and revenue by increasing vehicle reliability and lowering expenses.
  • Enhanced customer service. Improved communication and continuous data insights across the value chain help keep stakeholders informed.

Costumer references

  • Large manufacturer of commercial trucks and buses increases vehicle repairs completed within 24 hours, reducing costs, and monitors driver behaviors, improving safety and fuel efficiency.

  • Large U.S. heavy equipment manufacturer scales performance monitoring from 400,000 to 2 million vehicles, improving maintenance predictions and management of service supply chains.

  • Leading global equipment rental company gains efficiency with IoT and reduces revenue leakage by approximately $10 million.
